name: Muslim Advocates
mission: TO PROMOTE EQUALITY, LIBERTY AND JUSTICE FOR ALL, BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP THROUGH LEGAL ADVOCACY, POLICY ENGAGEMENT AND CIVIC EDUCATION AND BY SERVING A...
theoryOfChange: Works in the courts, the policy making process, and in the public dialogue (litigate, educate, and advocate) to uphold equal treatment under the law so American Muslims and all people can live free from discrimination.
zakatClaimEvidence:
Gifts made to Muslim Advocates are Zakat-eligible, more information is available.
In light of the social justice work Muslim Advocates performs, it is my informed assessment that Muslim Advocates is zakat eligible. This view is consistent with that taken by many legal-advocacy non-profit organizations working in service of Muslim communities. For the reasons set forth below, I believe that MA is a permitted recipient of zakat. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQH2vxeQvuWC4CPoTIhgmduAjmuAQLOBvXvCzO_VUgcuJ3dMyV5L0HHZ6r7MFeT0GcjgCBMNchWYbzZNEyby3KbHR2PCh--U7F5pOfrN0XhoFwHnBwLQLQ==)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 26/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Advocates shows good impact and moderate alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence:
Gifts made to Muslim Advocates are Zakat-eligible, more information is available.
In light of the social justice work Muslim Advocates performs, it is my informed assessment that Muslim Advocates is zakat eligible. This view is consistent with that taken by many legal-advocacy non-profit organizations working in service of Muslim communities. For the reasons set forth below, I believe that MA is a permitted recipient of zakat. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQH2vxeQvuWC4CPoTIhgmduAjmuAQLOBvXvCzO_VUgcuJ3dMyV5L0HHZ6r7MFeT0GcjgCBMNchWYbzZNEyby3KbHR2PCh--U7F5pOfrN0XhoFwHnBwLQLQ==)

all_citations.claim: Muslim Advocates is a civil rights organization focused on legal advocacy and policy engagement.
The organization reported total revenue of $992,892 and holds 7.8 months of working capital.
The organization engages in legal awards and advocacy programs.
Program activities include legal representation and civil rights advocacy.
The organization documents its accomplishments in civic education and policy engagement.
The organization provides donation options and is identified as zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score due to its established legal track record balanced against high fundraising costs and limited data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: The program expense ratio of 54.9% suggests a significant portion of funds is directed toward administrative and fundraising costs.
Fundraising efficiency is relatively low, costing $0.61 to raise every $1.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 26/50, the charity addresses the urgent cause of domestic poverty and civil rights, but shows low specific donor fit for traditional Muslim giving patterns despite being zakat-eligible [8]. Its mission focuses on systemic legal advocacy rather than direct social services [1][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building and legal awards to protect civil liberties, though its impact score of 31/50 reflects a program expense ratio of 54.9% and a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data [1][3][5]. Financial health is supported by 7.8 months of working capital, though data confidence remains low at 0.3 [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Advocates is a national civil rights organization dedicated to promoting equality and justice through legal advocacy and policy engagement.
strengths: Maintains a working capital of 7.8 months, providing a stable financial cushion for operations.
Provides direct legal representation and policy advocacy to address domestic civil rights issues.
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Washington, D.C., Muslim Advocates works to protect the rights of American Muslims and other marginalized communities through legal representation and civic education [1][2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $992,892 and is recognized as zakat-eligible for donors seeking to support civil rights initiatives [2][8].
